sentences.en: "Don't do it again," Franklin cabled her when he got her letter.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林收到她的信后给她拍了封电报，说：“别再那么做了。”

sentences.en: Franklin and his thirteen-year-old son somehow got separated in the crush.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林和他13岁的儿子在人群中被挤散了。

sentences.en: Franklin did not turn up until well after midnight.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林直到午夜过后很久才出现。

sentences.en: Franklin joined her and the children whenever his crowded calendar allowed.
sentences.cn: 只要能从百忙之中抽出空，富兰克林就会陪在妻儿身边。

sentences.en: Franklin told Sara that he had himself disdained to take the job.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林告诉萨拉他不屑于去做那份工作。

sentences.en: Franklin was free to do pretty much whatever he pleased.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林几乎可以做自己喜欢做的任何事情。

sentences.en: Franklin was predisposed to believe him.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林倾向于相信他。

sentences.en: Franklin went to work in his shirtsleeves.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林穿着衬衫去上班了。

sentences.en: Franklin's experiments showed that the lightning is an electrical discharge.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林的实验表明闪电是一种放电.

sentences.en: He decided Franklin must be suffering from a bad cold.
sentences.cn: 他断定富兰克林一定是得了重感冒。

sentences.en: I told Franklin he would have to start dinner without me.
sentences.cn: 我告诉富兰克林吃晚饭不必等我。

sentences.en: Sara was not amused by Franklin's teasing.
sentences.cn: 被富兰克林揶揄之后，萨拉的脸上全无笑意。

sentences.en: Scores of congratulatory telegrams and letters greeted Franklin on his return.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林一回来，就收到了好几十封贺电和贺信。

sentences.en: The Roosevelt family produced two presidents: Theodore Roosevelt and Franklin Roosevelt.
sentences.cn: 罗斯福家族出过两个总统: 西奥多·罗斯福和弗兰克林·罗斯福.

sentences.en: While Franklin saw to the luggage, Sara took Eleanor home.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林负责照看行李，萨拉则带着埃莉诺回家了。

phrases.tran_cn: n. 本杰明·富兰克林（美国政治家及科学家）
富兰克林·罗斯福（美国总统）
